intro: Agalinis stenantha, commonly known as slenderstem false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and linear, and it is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
